answers.answer: If your Dr seems ok with it I wouldn't worry. But that kinda seems like too much too soon.

That's way too much way too soon. You shouldn't gain anymore then 2-4 pounds in the first trimester. You should take a look at how much you're eating BC you're only supposed to eat an extra 300 calories a day.  That's only a yogurt and an Apple. You're not actually eating for two.. you don't want to gain too much BC you can get gestational diabetes that way.

I gained a lot of weight with my first. My Dr never said anything about it. They understand that it happens especially with your first. As your body doesn't really understand how to handle the pregnancy.

If you're hungry then eat... as my doctor says some girls gain it quick in the beginning while others don't start gaining until the end, I started gaining a lot when I hit 24 weeks and my doctor saysnita alright, I'm up 50lbs but I'm confident about losing it all. :) don't stress too much about it

I gained 15 pounds my first trimester due to lack of morning sickness and stopping medication i was taking that had side effects of weight loss. If it wasnt for that 15 id be at a normal weight gain. Some people gain a lot, others not so much. As long ad you make sure you are putting quality food in your body such as fresh fruits and veggies and staying as active as you can you will be okay.

question: Before pregnancy I was 117pounds and I've gained 9 pounds in 10 weeks. Is that normal?
title: 10 weeks, 9 pounds?
